device_fingerprint_dialog.confirm_restore_desc: Will restore to original fingerprint and overwrite current fingerprint. Confirm continue?

general.title: General Settings
general.auto_launch_desc: Automatically launch Antigravity Tools when system starts
general.auto_check_update_desc: Automatically check for new versions on startup

account.title: Account Settings
account.auto_refresh_desc: Automatically refresh all account quotas in the background. This is required for quota protection and smart warmup.
account.auto_sync_desc: Automatically sync current active account information periodically

warmup.title: Smart Warmup
warmup.desc: Automatically monitors all models and triggers warmup immediately when quota reaches 100%, keeping models warm

quota_protection.title: Quota Protection
quota_protection.enable_desc: Automatically disable proxy when account quota falls below threshold, and auto-restore when quota resets
quota_protection.monitored_models_desc: Select at least one. Protection triggers if ANY selected model falls below threshold
quota_protection.example: Example: At {{percentage}}%, an account with {{total}} quota will be disabled when remaining ‚â§ {{threshold}}
quota_protection.auto_restore_info: Account will be automatically re-enabled when quota resets

pinned_quota_models.title: Pinned Quota Models
pinned_quota_models.desc: Choose which model quotas to display in the account list. Unselected models are only shown in the detail popup.

advanced.title: Advanced Settings
advanced.default_export_path_desc: Files will be saved directly to this folder without asking
advanced.data_dir_desc: Account data and config file location
advanced.antigravity_path_desc: If you installed Antigravity in a non-standard location, you can manually specify the executable path here (Points to .app on MacOS).
advanced.antigravity_args_desc: Specify startup arguments for Antigravity, e.g. --user-data-dir to specify user data directory
advanced.page_size_desc: Set the number of accounts displayed per page. Select 'Auto Calculate' to dynamically adjust based on window size.
advanced.logs_desc: Clear log cache files. Does not affect account data.
advanced.clear_logs_msg: Are you sure you want to clear all log cache files?
advanced.antigravity_cache_desc: Clear Antigravity cache to resolve login failures, version validation errors, and OAuth authorization issues.
advanced.antigravity_cache_warning: Please ensure Antigravity is completely closed before clearing cache.
advanced.clear_cache_confirm_msg: The following cache directories will be cleared:
advanced.debug_logs_enable_desc: When enabled, records the complete request and response chain. Recommended to enable only when troubleshooting issues.
advanced.debug_logs_desc: Records the full chain: original input, transformed v1internal request, and upstream response. For troubleshooting only, may contain sensitive data.
advanced.debug_log_dir_hint: Leave empty to use the default directory: {{path}}/debug_logs
advanced.http_api_desc: Provides local HTTP interface for external programs (e.g. VS Code plugins).
advanced.http_api_enabled_desc: When enabled, external programs can manage accounts via HTTP interface
advanced.http_api_port_desc: Restart required after changing port. If port conflict occurs, please use another available port.
advanced.http_api_settings_saved: HTTP API settings saved, restart required to apply

debug.title: Debug Console
debug.desc: View real-time application logs for debugging
debug.disabled_desc: Enable to start recording application logs
debug.console_desc: View real-time application logs to troubleshoot issues.
debug.enable_desc: Enable to capture and display backend logs.
debug.debug_logging_desc: When enabled, records the complete request and response chain. Recommended to enable only when troubleshooting issues.

about.title: About
about.author: Author
about.brew_confirm_desc: The following command will be executed to update the app. A restart is required after the upgrade.
about.brew_quarantine_hint: If you see an "App is damaged" error after update, run in terminal:
about.brew_upgrade_success: Homebrew upgrade succeeded. Please restart the app to load the new version.
about.brew_restart_failed: Auto restart failed. Please close and reopen the app manually
about.brew_upgrade_failed: Homebrew upgrade failed. Try running manually: brew upgrade --cask antigravity-tools
about.brew_error_brew_not_found: Homebrew not found. Please ensure brew is installed
about.brew_error_brew_exec_failed: Failed to execute brew command. Try running manually in terminal

about.brew_error_brew_already_latest: Already up to date, no upgrade needed
about.brew_error_brew_not_supported: Homebrew update is not supported on this platform
about.support_desc: If you find this project helpful, feel free to buy me a coffee! Your support is the biggest motivation for me to maintain this project.

advanced_thinking.title: Advanced Thinking & Global Config
advanced_thinking.description: Manage thinking capabilities, image modes, and global instructions.

thinking_budget.title: Thinking Budget
thinking_budget.description: Controls the token budget for AI deep thinking. Some models (e.g., Flash, -thinking suffix models) are limited to 24576 by upstream API.
thinking_budget.auto_hint: Auto mode: Automatically caps budget to 24576 for Flash, -thinking suffix models, and Web Search requests.
thinking_budget.adaptive_hint: Adaptive mode: The model automatically adjusts thinking budget based on task complexity. Recommended for Claude 4.6+.
thinking_budget.passthrough_warning: Passthrough: Uses caller's value directly. High values may cause failures.

options.enabled_desc: On: Preserves thinking chain, returns sketch + final image.
options.disabled_desc: Off: Disables thinking chain, generates single ultra-clear image (Quality First).

global_system_prompt.title: Global System Prompt
global_system_prompt.placeholder:
Enter global system prompt...
Example: You are a senior full-stack developer. Please respond in English.
global_system_prompt.long_prompt_warning: Prompt is quite long (over 2000 chars) and may consume significant context space.

config.title: Service Configuration

request.user_agent_tooltip: Override the User-Agent header sent to upstream APIs. Leave empty to use default.

config.port_tooltip: TCP port the local API Proxy listens on. Stop the service to change it, then restart to apply.
config.port_hint: Default 8045, restart required to apply changes
config.auto_start_tooltip: Automatically starts the local API Proxy service when the app launches.
config.allow_lan_access_tooltip: When enabled, the service binds to 0.0.0.0 so other devices on your LAN can access it. Keep authorization enabled and protect your API key; restart required to apply.
config.allow_lan_access_hint_enabled: üåê Listening on 0.0.0.0, LAN devices can access
config.allow_lan_access_hint_disabled: üîí Listening on 127.0.0.1 only, localhost access (Privacy First)
config.allow_lan_access_warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è LAN devices can access when enabled. Keep your API key secure
config.allow_lan_access_restart_hint: ‚ÑπÔ∏è Service restart required to apply changes
config.api_key_tooltip: Shared secret used by clients when proxy authorization is enabled. Regenerating the key immediately invalidates the old one.
config.warning_key: Note: Keep your API key secure. Do not share it.
config.api_key_invalid: Invalid API key format, must start with sk- and be at least 10 characters long
config.admin_password_tooltip: Password used to log in to the Web management console. If empty, the API Key is used by default.
config.admin_password_placeholder: Enter new password, leave empty to use API Key
config.admin_password_hint: Tip: In Docker/Web deployment scenarios, you can set a separate login password to improve the security of your API Key.

auth.title: Authorization
auth.title_tooltip: Controls whether incoming requests must be authenticated, and which routes are protected.
auth.enabled_tooltip: Turns authorization on/off by switching the authorization mode. When enabled, clients must include the API key via Authorization: Bearer <API_KEY> or x-api-key.
auth.mode_tooltip: Selects which routes require the API key: Off = no auth; All = protect everything; All except Health = /healthz stays open; Auto = Off for localhost-only, otherwise All except Health.
auth.hint: When enabled, clients must send the API key via Authorization: Bearer ... (except health if selected).

zai.title: z.ai (GLM) Provider
zai.title_tooltip: Optional Anthropic-compatible upstream for Claude protocol. Only affects Anthropic endpoints; Google account routing remains unchanged.
zai.subtitle: Optional Anthropic-compatible upstream for Claude protocol only.
zai.enabled_tooltip: Enables z.ai routing for Anthropic requests according to the selected dispatch mode.
zai.base_url_tooltip: Anthropic-compatible base URL. The proxy appends paths like /v1/messages. Leave the default unless you use a custom gateway.
zai.dispatch_mode_tooltip: Controls when to use z.ai for Anthropic requests: Off disables it; All Anthropic requests forwards everything; Pooled adds z.ai as one slot in round-robin with Google accounts; Fallback uses z.ai only when there are no Google accounts.
zai.api_key_tooltip: API key used to authenticate requests to z.ai. Stored locally and required for z.ai and MCP features.
zai.api_key_placeholder: Paste your z.ai API key here
zai.warning: Note: This key is stored locally in the app data directory.

models.title: Model Mapping
models.title_tooltip: Fetch available z.ai model ids and configure how incoming Anthropic/Claude model names are translated to z.ai model ids.
models.hint: Available models: {{count}}. Select a suggestion or type a custom model id.
models.opus_tooltip: Default z.ai model id used when the incoming model contains "opus" (e.g. claude-opus-*).
models.sonnet_tooltip: Default z.ai model id used for other Claude models (e.g. claude-sonnet-* and most claude-* requests).
models.haiku_tooltip: Default z.ai model id used when the incoming model contains "haiku" (e.g. claude-haiku-*).
models.advanced_tooltip: Optional exact-match overrides. If an incoming model string matches a rule key, it will be replaced with the mapped z.ai model id.

mcp.title: MCP Servers (via local proxy)
mcp.title_tooltip: Exposes optional /mcp/* endpoints on this local proxy so MCP clients can connect. Available only when the service is running, z.ai is configured, and the corresponding toggles are enabled.
mcp.enabled_tooltip: Master switch for MCP endpoints. When off, all /mcp/* routes return 404.
mcp.web_search_tooltip: Exposes /mcp/web_search_prime/mcp and forwards requests to the z.ai Web Search MCP upstream.
mcp.web_reader_tooltip: Exposes /mcp/web_reader/mcp and forwards requests to the z.ai Web Reader MCP upstream.
mcp.vision_tooltip: Exposes /mcp/zai-mcp-server/mcp (local MCP server) that provides vision tools backed by z.ai.
mcp.local_endpoints: Local endpoints (configure your MCP client to use these URLs):
mcp.local_endpoints_tooltip: Use these URLs in your MCP client. They share the same host/port as the API Proxy and follow the proxy authorization policy.

config.request_timeout_tooltip: Maximum time (seconds) the proxy waits for an upstream response, including streaming. Increase for long generations; restart required to apply.
config.request_timeout_hint: Default 120s, range 30-7200s. Restart service to apply changes.
config.enable_logging_hint: Record history for debugging (Minor perf cost)

upstream_proxy.title: Global Upstream Proxy (Global Proxy)
upstream_proxy.desc: When enabled, all external requests (API Proxy, Token Refresh, Quota Check, Update Check) will be routed through this proxy.
upstream_proxy.desc_short: Fallback proxy used when no suitable proxy is found in the pool.
upstream_proxy.socks5h_hint: To bypass upstream risk control and use Remote DNS resolution, manually change the protocol to socks5h://
upstream_proxy.validation_error: Proxy URL is required when upstream proxy is enabled
upstream_proxy.restart_hint: Proxy settings saved. Restart the app to apply changes.

scheduling.title: Account Rotation & Scheduling
scheduling.title_tooltip: Controls how sessions are bound to accounts and how rate limits are handled.
scheduling.subtitle: Optimizes Prompt Caching and rate limit handling for all protocols (OpenAI/Gemini/Claude).
scheduling.mode_tooltip: Cache-First: Bind session to account, wait on rate limit (maximize cache utility); Balance: Bind session, switch account on rate limit; Performance: Standard Round-robin.

modes_desc.CacheFirst: Binds session to account, waits precisely if limited (Maximizes Prompt Cache hits).
modes_desc.Balance: Binds session, auto-switches to available account if limited (Balanced cache & availability).
modes_desc.PerformanceFirst: No session binding, pure round-robin rotation (Best for high concurrency).

scheduling.max_wait_tooltip: Only used in 'Cache First' mode: wait instead of switching if the rate limit reset time is below this value.
scheduling.clear_bindings_tooltip: Hard reset all session-account bindings, forcing accounts to be re-assigned on next request.
scheduling.clear_rate_limits_tooltip: Immediately clear local rate limit records for all accounts, forcing next requests to try upstream directly.

circuit_breaker.title: Adaptive Circuit Breaker
circuit_breaker.tooltip: Automatically increases lockout duration for accounts that repeatedly fail with quota exhaustion. This prevents wasting API calls on dead accounts while allowing transient errors to recover quickly.
circuit_breaker.input_placeholder: Enter backoff durations in seconds, separated by commas
circuit_breaker.invalid_format: Invalid format. Use comma separated numbers (e.g. 60, 300)

experimental.title: Experimental Settings
experimental.title_tooltip: Exploratory features that may be adjusted or removed in future versions.
experimental.enable_usage_scaling_tooltip: For Claude protocol. Enables aggressive scaling when total input exceeds 30k tokens to prevent frequent client-side compression. Note: Reported usage will not reflect actual billing after enabling.
experimental.context_compression_threshold_l1_tooltip: Trims old tool call records to save space. Recommended: 0.4 (40%)
experimental.context_compression_threshold_l2_tooltip: Compresses early thinking blocks while preserving signatures. Recommended: 0.55 (55%)
experimental.context_compression_threshold_l3_tooltip: Ultimate reset: generates an XML state summary and pivots to a fresh session. Most token-efficient. Recommended: 0.7 (70%)

opencode_sync.sync_confirm_message: OpenCode config will be overwritten based on current proxy settings. Continue?

cloudflared.title: Public Access (Cloudflared)
cloudflared.subtitle: Expose your local service to the internet via Cloudflare Tunnel
cloudflared.install_hint: Cloudflared is a free tunnel tool from Cloudflare. It exposes your local proxy to the internet without a public IP or port forwarding. Click the button below to install.
cloudflared.mode_quick_desc: Auto-generated temporary URL (*.trycloudflare.com), no account needed, URL changes on restart
cloudflared.mode_auth_desc: Use Cloudflare account token, supports custom domain, persistent URL
cloudflared.token_placeholder: Paste your Cloudflare Tunnel Token here
cloudflared.token_hint: Get from Cloudflare Zero Trust dashboard
cloudflared.token_required: Token is required for Named Tunnel mode
cloudflared.use_http2_desc: More compatible, recommended for China mainland
cloudflared.public_url_placeholder: Public URL will appear here after tunnel starts
cloudflared.require_proxy_running: Please start the local proxy service first

example.title: Usage Examples
example.python_anthropic:
from anthropic import Anthropic

client = Anthropic(
    # Recommended: 127.0.0.1
    base_url="{{baseUrl}}",
    api_key="{{apiKey}}"
)

# Note: Antigravity supports calling any model via the Anthropic SDK
response = client.messages.create(
    model="{{modelId}}",
    max_tokens=1024,
    messages=[{"role": "user", "content": "Hello"}]
)

print(response.content[0].text)
example.python_gemini:
# Install: pip install google-generativeai
import google.generativeai as genai

# Use Antigravity proxy address (recommended 127.0.0.1)
genai.configure(
    api_key="{{apiKey}}",
    transport='rest',
    client_options={'api_endpoint': '{{rawBaseUrl}}'}
)

model = genai.GenerativeModel('{{modelId}}')
response = model.generate_content("Hello")
print(response.text)
example.python_openai_image:
from openai import OpenAI

client = OpenAI(
    base_url="{{baseUrl}}",
    api_key="{{apiKey}}"
)

response = client.chat.completions.create(
    model="{{modelId}}",
    # Option 1: use size (recommended)
    # Supported: "1024x1024" (1:1), "1280x720" (16:9), "720x1280" (9:16), "1216x896" (4:3)
    extra_body={ "size": "1024x1024" },

    # Option 2: use model suffix
    # e.g. gemini-3-pro-image-16-9, gemini-3-pro-image-4-3
    # model="gemini-3-pro-image-16-9",
    messages=[{
        "role": "user",
        "content": "Draw a futuristic city"
    }]
)

print(response.choices[0].message.content)
example.python_openai:
from openai import OpenAI

client = OpenAI(
    base_url="{{baseUrl}}",
    api_key="{{apiKey}}"
)

response = client.chat.completions.create(
    model="{{modelId}}",
    messages=[{"role": "user", "content": "Hello"}]
)

print(response.choices[0].message.content)

mapping.title: Claude Code Model Mapping
mapping.description: Map Claude Code models to Antigravity models. Optimize cost and speed by routing requests intelligently.

router.title: Model Router
router.subtitle:
Route models by series or add custom exact mappings.
Note: Native Claude pass-through models (e.g. claude-opus-4-6-thinking) bypass series groups by default. Use "Expert Custom Routing" to override.
router.subtitle_simple: Customize model routing with wildcards or exact mappings
router.background_task_desc: Model used for Claude CLI background tasks like title generation, summary, etc. (Default: gemini-2.5-flash)
router.save_hint: Saves the currently active model mappings as a reusable preset.
router.expert_subtitle: Precise matching for any original model ID.
router.custom_mapping_tip: üí° Supports manual input of any model ID to experience unreleased models (e.g. claude-opus-4-6).
router.custom_mapping_warning: Note: Not all accounts support unreleased models.
router.haiku_optimization_tip: Claude CLI uses {{model}} for background tasks by default. Map it to a cheaper Flash model to save ~95% costs
router.haiku_tip_body_after: for background tasks; mapping it to a cheaper Flash model can save about 95% of the cost.
router.reset_confirm: Reset all mappings to system defaults?

perplexity.cookieInstructions:
Recommended:
1. Press F12 to open Developer Tools, switch to [Network] tab
2. Refresh page, click any request (e.g. session)
3. Find 'Cookie' in [Request Headers]
4. Right click Cookie value -> Copy value
